summary.implementation_status: Basic admin functionality exists (dashboard, user management) but admin-specific optimizations are largely missing. The dashboard has widgets with KPIs and trends, but lacks a dedicated business health overview for executives. Exception alerting, approval queue, team performance, and scheduled reports are not implemented. Xero integration status exists in settings. Trigger.dev email report infrastructure exists but no scheduled report delivery system.

schema_files: /Users/joelchan/Documents/Coding/App-Dev/live/renoz-crm-tanstack/renoz-v2/lib/enums.ts - USER_ROLES defines admin, sales, warehouse, viewer
server_functions: /Users/joelchan/Documents/Coding/App-Dev/live/renoz-crm-tanstack/renoz-v2/src/server/functions/dashboard.ts - getDashboardMetrics with comprehensive KPIs (pipeline, orders, warranties, issues, customers)
components: /Users/joelchan/Documents/Coding/App-Dev/live/renoz-crm-tanstack/renoz-v2/src/components/domain/dashboard/enhanced-dashboard-page.tsx - Main dashboard with widgets, alerts for expiring warranties and high issues
/Users/joelchan/Documents/Coding/App-Dev/live/renoz-crm-tanstack/renoz-v2/src/components/domain/dashboard/role-defaults.ts - getRoleDefaultLayout for admin (full dashboard with all widgets)
/Users/joelchan/Documents/Coding/App-Dev/live/renoz-crm-tanstack/renoz-v2/src/components/domain/dashboard/widget-registry.tsx - Widget types: kpi-revenue, kpi-orders, kpi-pipeline, etc.
routes: /Users/joelchan/Documents/Coding/App-Dev/live/renoz-crm-tanstack/renoz-v2/src/routes/index.tsx - Dashboard route (default landing for all roles)
background_jobs: /Users/joelchan/Documents/Coding/App-Dev/live/renoz-crm-tanstack/renoz-v2/trigger/email-report.ts - Email report task (manual trigger, not scheduled delivery)

role_based_access.admin_role_check: IMPLEMENTED - User management page checks session.role === 'admin'
role_based_access.role_based_dashboard_defaults: IMPLEMENTED - getRoleDefaultLayout provides admin-specific full dashboard layout
role_based_access.user_management: IMPLEMENTED - Full CRUD with role assignment, invite, deactivate/reactivate

dashboard_metrics.kpi_widgets: IMPLEMENTED - Revenue, Orders, Pipeline, Warranties, Issues, Avg Order Value
dashboard_metrics.trend_indicators: IMPLEMENTED - Revenue trend vs previous month percentage
dashboard_metrics.sparklines: IMPLEMENTED - 7-day sparklines for revenue, orders, customers, issues
dashboard_metrics.contextual_alerts: PARTIAL - Expiring warranties and high issues alerts exist, but no comprehensive exception dashboard

xero_integration_status.connection_status: IMPLEMENTED - getXeroConnectionStatus shows connected state, tenant info
xero_integration_status.health_indicator: NOT IMPLEMENTED - No visual health indicator (green/yellow/red)
xero_integration_status.sync_status: PARTIAL - Last sync not tracked, no pending syncs indicator

reports_system.report_generation: IMPLEMENTED - Sales, Pipeline, Inventory, Customer, Warranty reports
reports_system.email_delivery: PARTIAL - Trigger.dev task exists for emailing reports, but no scheduled delivery system
reports_system.report_scheduling: NOT IMPLEMENTED - No scheduled_reports table or UI

ROLE-ADMIN-001.name: Business Health Dashboard
ROLE-ADMIN-001.reason: Dashboard exists with KPIs (revenue, orders, pipeline, warranties, issues) and trend indicators. However, it's not admin-specific landing, lacks comparison toggle, drill-down navigation, and date range selector is not prominent. The foundation is strong but needs executive-focused enhancements.

sub_stories.name: Add Date Range Selector to Dashboard Header
sub_stories.description: Add visible date range selector in dashboard header for admin view
acceptance_criteria: Date range selector visible in dashboard header
Presets: Today, This Week, This Month, This Quarter, YTD

sub_stories.name: Add KPI Drill-Down Navigation
sub_stories.description: Make KPI widgets clickable to navigate to relevant list pages with context
acceptance_criteria: Revenue KPI links to orders filtered by date range
Orders KPI links to orders by status
Pipeline KPI links to pipeline page
Issues KPI links to issues list

evidence: enhanced-dashboard-page.tsx: KPIWidget components with revenue, orders, pipeline, issues
dashboard.ts: getDashboardMetrics returns comprehensive KPIs with trends
role-defaults.ts: admin layout includes kpi-revenue, kpi-orders, kpi-pipeline, kpi-warranties, kpi-issues, charts, tables

ROLE-ADMIN-002.name: Exception Alerts Dashboard
ROLE-ADMIN-002.reason: Basic alerts exist for expiring warranties and high open issues in the dashboard, but there is no dedicated exceptions widget with categories (overdue invoices, stuck orders, low stock, stale quotes), counts per category, acknowledgment, or alert badge in nav.

sub_stories.name: Add Exception Detection Server Functions
sub_stories.description: Server functions to detect various exception categories
acceptance_criteria: getExceptionSummary returns counts for: overdue invoices, stuck orders, low stock, stale quotes
Stale quotes: quoted opportunities > 14 days without activity
Low stock: products below reorder point
Overdue invoices: unpaid past due date

sub_stories.name: Add Exceptions Widget
sub_stories.description: Dashboard widget showing exception categories with counts
acceptance_criteria: Count badge per category with color coding (red for critical)
Click category to see detail list
Add to widget registry and catalog

sub_stories.name: Add Exception Alert Badge in Navigation
sub_stories.description: Show unacknowledged exception count in nav/header
acceptance_criteria: Exception count badge near notification bell or dashboard link

evidence: enhanced-dashboard-page.tsx: alerts array checks metricsData.warranties.expiringIn30Days and metricsData.issues.openCount
No dedicated exceptions table or acknowledgment system

ROLE-ADMIN-003.name: Approval Queue
ROLE-ADMIN-003.reason: No approval queue or workflow system exists. This depends on DOM-SUPP-002 (PO Approval Workflow) which defines approval rules. The approval queue page would provide a centralized view for admins to approve pending items (quotes over threshold, POs over threshold).

dependencies_status.DOM-SUPP-002: NOT IMPLEMENTED - PO Approval Workflow is pending

acceptance_criteria_review.pending_items: NOT IMPLEMENTED - No approval thresholds defined

ROLE-ADMIN-003.note: Block until DOM-SUPP-002 is implemented to define approval rules and pending_approval status

ROLE-ADMIN-004.name: Team Performance Metrics
ROLE-ADMIN-004.reason: No team performance tracking exists. While audit logs track user actions, there is no aggregated view of user productivity metrics (orders processed, quotes sent, jobs completed) or leaderboard.

sub_stories.name: Add Team Performance Server Functions
sub_stories.description: Server functions to aggregate user activity metrics
acceptance_criteria: Metrics: orders processed count, quotes sent count, jobs completed count
Aggregate from orders, opportunities, jobs tables by user
Support filtering by role and date range

sub_stories.name: Add Team Performance Page
sub_stories.description: Admin page showing team productivity metrics
acceptance_criteria: Table with user name, role, and metrics columns
Leaderboard toggle view (ranked by total activity)
Date range filter and role filter

sub_stories.name: Add User Trend Charts
sub_stories.description: Activity trend over time per user
acceptance_criteria: Expandable row or sidebar showing user trend

evidence: No team performance table or server functions
Audit logs track actions but not aggregated for performance view

ROLE-ADMIN-005.name: Trend Analysis Charts
ROLE-ADMIN-005.reason: Revenue trend chart exists with comparison support in getEnhancedTimeSeriesData. However, there is no dedicated trends page with multiple chart types (order volume, pipeline value), period toggle (daily/weekly/monthly), and export functionality.

sub_stories.name: Create Trends Page Route
sub_stories.description: Add dedicated trends/analytics page for admins
acceptance_criteria: Page layout with multiple chart areas

sub_stories.name: Add Multiple Trend Charts
sub_stories.description: Revenue, order volume, and pipeline trend charts
acceptance_criteria: Revenue trend chart with comparison line
Charts respect period and date range

sub_stories.name: Add Chart Export
sub_stories.description: Export trend charts as images
acceptance_criteria: Include chart title and date range in export

evidence: dashboard.ts: getEnhancedTimeSeriesData supports revenue, orders, customers, issues metrics

ROLE-ADMIN-006.name: System Health Overview
ROLE-ADMIN-006.reason: Xero connection status exists in settings but there is no unified system health section showing all integrations (Xero, Resend, AI), background job status, database connection, or backup info. Depends on INT-XERO-008 and INT-RES-008 for integration status widgets.

dependencies_status.INT-XERO-008: NOT IMPLEMENTED - Xero Dashboard Widget pending
dependencies_status.INT-RES-008: NOT IMPLEMENTED - Email Status Widget pending

sub_stories.name: Add System Health Server Function
sub_stories.description: Server function to check all system components
acceptance_criteria: getSystemHealth returns status for each component

sub_stories.name: Add System Health Section in Settings
sub_stories.description: Settings section showing all integration statuses
acceptance_criteria: System health section in settings page
Integration cards: Xero, Resend, AI - each with green/yellow/red status
Last successful operation timestamp per integration

evidence: xero.tsx: Xero connection status page exists
xero-status.tsx: XeroStatus component shows connection details
ROLE-ADMIN-006.note: Can be implemented independently but will be enhanced when INT-XERO-008 and INT-RES-008 provide richer status data

ROLE-ADMIN-007.name: Quick Decision Data
ROLE-ADMIN-007.reason: Entity detail pages exist (customer, product) but do not show aggregated quick stats (total revenue, order count, avg order for customers; units sold, revenue, margin for products). AI insight suggestion is optional and depends on AI infrastructure.

sub_stories.name: Add Customer Quick Stats Server Function
sub_stories.description: Server function to get customer summary stats
acceptance_criteria: getCustomerQuickStats(customerId) returns total revenue, order count, avg order value

sub_stories.name: Add Product Quick Stats Server Function
sub_stories.description: Server function to get product summary stats
acceptance_criteria: getProductQuickStats(productId) returns units sold, total revenue, margin

sub_stories.name: Add Quick Stats Component to Detail Pages
sub_stories.description: Display quick stats on customer and product detail pages
acceptance_criteria: Add to customer detail page header/sidebar
Add to product detail page header/sidebar

evidence: No quick stats components on these pages

ROLE-ADMIN-008.name: Scheduled Report Delivery
ROLE-ADMIN-008.reason: Trigger.dev emailReport task exists for sending reports, but there is no scheduled_reports table, no scheduling UI, and no automatic recurring delivery. The infrastructure is partially in place. Depends on INT-RES-005 (batch email) and INT-AI-004 (AI reports) for advanced features.

dependencies_status.INT-RES-005: NOT IMPLEMENTED - Batch Email Support pending (enhances delivery)
dependencies_status.INT-AI-004: NOT IMPLEMENTED - Scheduled AI Reports pending (different report type)

sub_stories.name: Create Scheduled Reports Schema
sub_stories.description: Add scheduled_reports table for report scheduling configuration
acceptance_criteria: scheduled_reports table: id, name, reportType, frequency, recipients, format, filters, orgId, createdBy, isActive, lastRunAt, nextRunAt

sub_stories.name: Add Scheduled Reports Server Functions
sub_stories.description: CRUD for scheduled reports configuration
acceptance_criteria: getNextRunTime calculates next delivery based on frequency

sub_stories.name: Add Scheduled Reports UI
sub_stories.description: Settings page for managing scheduled reports
acceptance_criteria: Scheduled reports management page in settings
Create report schedule form: name, report type, frequency (daily/weekly/monthly), recipients, format (PDF/CSV)
List of scheduled reports with edit/delete

sub_stories.name: Add Trigger.dev Cron Job for Delivery
sub_stories.description: Background job to execute scheduled reports
acceptance_criteria: Trigger.dev cron job checks for due reports (daily at 6 AM)
Job triggers existing emailReport task for each due report
Updates lastRunAt and nextRunAt after execution

evidence: trigger/email-report.ts: emailReport task sends report via Resend with attachment
reports.ts: getSalesReport, getPipelineReport, etc. provide report data
No scheduled_reports table or scheduling UI
ROLE-ADMIN-008.note: Can be implemented without INT-RES-005 and INT-AI-004, but those would enhance capabilities

recommended_stories.name: Add Exception Detection Server Functions
recommended_stories.rationale: Foundation for exception alerts - identifies critical business issues that need attention

recommended_stories.name: Add Date Range Selector to Dashboard Header
recommended_stories.rationale: High value, low effort - enhances existing dashboard with date filtering

recommended_stories.name: Add Customer Quick Stats Server Function
recommended_stories.rationale: Quick win - single server function to power quick decision data

recommended_stories.name: Create Scheduled Reports Schema
recommended_stories.rationale: Schema foundation enables scheduled report delivery feature

recommended_stories.name: Add Team Performance Server Functions
recommended_stories.rationale: Foundation for team performance - valuable for admin oversight

atomization_notes.ROLE-ADMIN-001: Split into 2 sub-stories: date range selector + KPI drill-down navigation. Foundation exists, needs UI enhancements.
atomization_notes.ROLE-ADMIN-002: Split into 3 sub-stories: exception detection server + widget + nav badge. Core feature gap.
atomization_notes.ROLE-ADMIN-003: No atomization - blocked by DOM-SUPP-002 dependency. Implement as single unit after dependency.
atomization_notes.ROLE-ADMIN-004: Split into 3 sub-stories: server functions + page + trend charts. New feature.
atomization_notes.ROLE-ADMIN-005: Split into 3 sub-stories: trends page route + chart components + export. Some infrastructure exists.
atomization_notes.ROLE-ADMIN-006: Split into 2 sub-stories: health server function + settings section. Partially exists for Xero.
atomization_notes.ROLE-ADMIN-007: Split into 3 sub-stories: customer stats + product stats + UI component. Entity pages exist.
atomization_notes.ROLE-ADMIN-008: Split into 4 sub-stories: schema + server + UI + cron job. Trigger.dev infrastructure exists.

blocked_stories: ROLE-ADMIN-003 (Approval Queue) - Blocked by DOM-SUPP-002 (PO Approval Workflow)
high_complexity_stories: ROLE-ADMIN-002 (Exception Alerts) - Requires cross-domain exception detection
ROLE-ADMIN-008 (Scheduled Reports) - Crosses all layers including background jobs
dependencies_to_verify: ROLE-ADMIN-003 depends on DOM-SUPP-002 - PO approval workflow must define approval rules first
ROLE-ADMIN-006 enhanced by INT-XERO-008 and INT-RES-008 - integration status widgets
ROLE-ADMIN-008 enhanced by INT-RES-005 and INT-AI-004 - batch email and AI reports
technical_debt: Debug logging statements in dashboard.ts should be removed before production
Dashboard alerts system is basic - could be consolidated with new exceptions system

implementation_order_recommendation: Phase 1: ROLE-ADMIN-001 (Business Health - enhances existing), ROLE-ADMIN-007 (Quick Stats - low complexity)
Phase 2: ROLE-ADMIN-002 (Exceptions - core admin value), ROLE-ADMIN-004 (Team Performance)
Phase 4: ROLE-ADMIN-008 (Scheduled Reports - background job complexity)
